edu.rit.se.coolTeamB.customer

Class CustomerManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • edu.rit.se.coolTeamB.customer.CustomerManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class CustomerManager
extends java.util.Observable
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    The CustomerManager Java class provides utility functions which are performed using the customer user interface - CustomerUI.
    Version:
    1.00 21 Mar 2013
    Author:
    Michael Surdouski (mxs1649@rit.edu)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CustomerManager(java.util.List<LocalVend> localVends)
      CustomerManager handles all customer access level changing of information in the SVM system.

        public boolean verifyBegin(int ID)
                    throws IllegalLockOperationException
        Verifies that the machine is unlocked, then locks it to begin the services provided.
        Parameters:
        - - none
        Postcondition:
        localVendingMachine lock status is true
        Returns:
        true if ready to begin transaction

      • addMoney

        public void addMoney(int ID,
            double amount)
              throws NegativeInputException
        Add money to running total on localVendingMachine.
        Precondition:
        amount of money added doesn't bypass double memory limitations the amount of money isn't negative
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount of money to be added to running total on machine
        Postcondition:
        amount has been added to running total
        Throws:
        NegativeInputException

      • addToShoppingCart

        public void addToShoppingCart(int ID,
                     int row,
                     int col,
                     int numberToAdd)
                       throws NonExistingStockException,
                              OutOfBoundsStockException,
                              NegativeInputException,
                              StockException
        Add specified amount of item to shopping cart.
        Preconditions:
        howMany <= (current stock of item - amount of item already existing on the shopping cart) howMany > 0 item with name itemName exists in localVendingMachine register
        Parameters:
        item -
        howMany - the amount to be added to shopping cart
        Postcondition:
        shopping cart has been updated
        Throws:
        NegativeInputException
        StockException
        NonExistingStockException
        OutOfBoundsStockException

      • checkOut

        public double checkOut(int ID)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                       OutOfBoundsStockException,
                       NonExistingStockException,
                       StockException
        Complete the transaction for items in shopping cart.
        Preconditions:
        shopping cart isn't empty there are sufficient funds to purchase items on shopping cart
        Returns:
        the amount of change customer receives
        Postcondition:
        shopping cart is empty running total for money is empty
        Throws:
        OutOfBoundsStockException
        StockException
        NonExistingStockException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
